abstract: German government plans to accept possibly up to 800,000 new immigrants, including thousands of asylum seekers, raises concerns about long-term political, social and economic effects; government, looking back on previous failure with guest workers, wants to integrate newcomers immediately despite some anti-immigration backlash.
lead_paragraph: Although Germans have met waves of newcomers with an outpouring of generosity, the country has also experienced a formidable backlash against the migrants.

headline.main: As Germany Welcomes Migrants, Some Wonder How to Make Acceptance Last
headline.print_headline: Germany Welcomes Migrants, With Concerns About Lasting Acceptance

snippet: Although Germans have met waves of newcomers with an outpouring of generosity, the country has also experienced a formidable backlash against the migrants.

keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
keywords.name: subject
